thread.title: He denounces the new US sanctions - 2024-04-25 21:13:06 - Archyde
thread.title_full: He denounces the new US sanctions - 2024-04-25 21:13:06 - Archyde

author: archyde
title: He denounces the new US sanctions - 2024-04-25 21:13:06 - Archyde
text:
Iran has called new sanctions imposed by the United States on two companies and four individuals that Washington says are involved in malicious cyberattacks unfounded.
These attacks were carried out “in the name of the cyber command of the Revolutionary Guard Corps”, the ideological army of the Islamic Republic of Iran announced yesterday, Tuesday, the US Treasury Department.
They were carried out “against businesses and US government entities”, according to Washington.
Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Nasser Kanaani “strongly rejected and condemned the baseless allegations of the US government against Iranian individuals and businesses.”
According to Kanaani, the United States “accuse individuals and Iranian institutions without any basis” in order to divert attention as he said from “the wave of criticism around the world against the United States’ policies of unlimited support for the war crimes and genocide committed by the Zionist regime [το Ισραήλ ] in his war against her Gaza Strip ».
The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps Cyber ​​Command is one of the Iranian government agencies behind the hacks, working through a series of front companies to target the United States and several other countries, the Treasury Department said. USA .
For the US Treasury Department, the Iranian people “need to know” that this administration is “using private companies and their employees to achieve its illegal goals.”
The US and Britain tightened sanctions against Iran after the attack on Israel According to iefimerida, last Thursday, the US, in coordination with Britain, was the first to strengthen sanctions against Iran after the attack launched by the latter against Israel on April 13, targeting “the Iranian program drones, the steel industry and car manufacturers’.
The attack launched by Iran followed an airstrike Tehran attributed to Israel in which seven members of the Revolutionary Guards, including two generals, were killed at the Iranian consulate in Damascus.
